--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Bjarne Andersen <bja@s...> wrote:
>=
 Would it be possible to put in new QueueAssignmentPolicies without 
> havi=
ng to alter:
> 
> private final static String [] AVAILABLE_QUEUE_ASSIGNMENT=
_POLICIES
> 
> in AbstractFrontier.java followed by a rebuild.
> 

Yes.  Ho=
w about adding a line in heritrix.properties that looked like
this:

org.ar=
chive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.queue-assignment-policy
=3D org.arc=
hive.crawler.frontier.HostnameQueueAssignmentPolicy,
org.archive.crawler.fr=
ontier.IPQueueAssignmentPolicy...

> e.g. with a line in Frontier.options

=
Frontier.options is used by the CrawlOrder object figuring what to
display =
for frontier options whereas assignment policies is an
attribute of a parti=
cular Frontier implementation so doesn't belong in
Frontier.options.  We co=
uld perhaps add a
QueueAssignmentPolicy.modules but currently modules are b=
uilt into the
 heritrix jar -- whereas heritrix.properties is not -- so add=
ing new
policies would be a bit of a pain (You'd add the new policy then ha=
ve
to remake the jar).

Yours,
St.Ack
